characters: CAT ON THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING
UNDER THE FLOOR FROM THE CAMERA'S POV
A FIST COLLIDING WITH A FACE
THE GUNMAN WITH THE GUN TO CAT'S HEAD
A DOOR TO AN SUV OPENS...
CAT EXITS THE STAIRS ON THE SIXTH FLOOR.
IT IS CAT, ALL GROWN UP.
AGAIN, THE CAMERA WATCHES HER AS IF THERE IS SOMEONE ELSE
ARE COMING UP. AND JUST WHEN THEY ARE ONE FLOOR APART,
THE CAMERA STAYS FOCUSED ON THE CHIMNEY.
A MOMENT LATER THE SWAT COME RUNNING BY WHERE SHE EXITED.
TRACK WITH THE KNIVES AND THEN...
PULL BACK TO THE TWO AMERICANS LOOKING AT EACH OTHER
HER EXPOSED CLEAVAGE. A MEDALLION ENGRAVED WITH THE
CAT SHOULDERING A LAWS SHOULDER ROCKET
UNTIL A RED BLINKING CIRCLE APPEARS ON THE MAP AROUND ONE
A SIMPLE FLOOR PLAN OF A HOUSE
A MAGAZINE PULLED FROM THE ENVELOPE
A PICTURE OF DEAD RIZZO ON THE FRONT PAGE.
A PICTURE OF RIZZO BEING PINNED TO A WALL
A SEWER GRATE CUT INTO THE SIDE OF THE CURB
AS THE CAMERA WATCHES HER, IT FEELS LIKE SOMEONE ELSE IS
PULL BACK TO THE SWAT PASSING BY LOOKING EVERYWHERE.
WHERE A VERY FAMILIAR MEDALLION ON A CHAIN HANGS BETWEEN
MARCO DON LUIS AND THE THUGS
AND STILL, THERE IS THIS FEELING SOMEONE IS THERE, WATCHI
THERE. THIS BEGINS TO FEEL A LITTLE CREEPY. VERY TENSE.
A REAL CATALEYA ORCHID ON A COMPUTER SCREEN WITH THE WORD
AND THEN THE MESSAGE COMES UP
CATALEYA BEING TYPED IN THE SEARCH BAR
THE RED TRUCK COMES RAMMING THROUGH, TAKES OUT THE WHOLE
SPLASHING AROUND A SWIMMING POOL HAVING THE BEST TIME
TRACK CAT AS SHE SLIDES AT A FANTASTIC SPEED DOWN THE
OVER THE INTONATIONS OF A CHOIR SINGING EASTER MASS...
THAT AT ANY MOMENT, SOMEONE IS GOING TO POUNCE.
THREE OF THE HOTTEST NYMPHETTES IN THE SMALLEST BIKINIS
SPLASHING WATER AT WILLIAM WOOGARD, AS HE CHASES AFTER
THE FACE OF A MIDDLE AGED AMERICAN
AND THE CONCEALED METAL PIPE CATCHES THEM ACROSS THEIR
A PHOTO OF CAT WITH HER PARENTS
WHEN IT SEEMS THAT THEY ARE GOING TO COLLIDE, RUN INTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATALEYA RESTREPO, CAT for short, a contained, very centered 10 year old, pretty, but with a toughness, sitti at the dining room table, in a well kept, but modest home with windows that look out over the steep hillside favela attends to her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the window there are half a dozen beautiful orchid plants. The rare Cataleya orchid. All around there are packed cartons, suitcases. Moving day is at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat! Is your homework finished yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working on it Mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother, taking time off from packing, comes over to Cat, and turns the page of the notebook to reveal the Lar Croft comic and it's copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You draw beautifully my love, but if you want to be something in life you have to study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am studying Mama. I want to be a super hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother turns the page back to the lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better to be a doctor. A lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to see Uncle Emilio? 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just waiting to hear from your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks up at a picture on the wall of the family. Cat, her mother, and her father. Her face carries a bit of worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mid 40'S, a gentleman, calm, courteous, impeccably dresse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a table, with bottle of liquor and two glasses, Don Luis sits opposite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's father. Off to the side, Don Luis's right hand man, MARCO, stands like any right hand, unobtrusive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I love you Fabio. Like a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love you Don Luis. Like a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Marco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe this guy Marco? We started when we were little...how old were we Fabio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten year old bastards stealing apples from the carts in the market. After all we've been through. And now we're on top, he wants to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luis, I'm going to be honest with you. You remember I had that operation? 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since then, I'm not a hundred percent. And you can't do this thing if you're not a hundred percent. I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll take a rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how many times we should have been dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even want to count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I. But you gotta think. How lucky we are to still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's right. We're alive. And what about the future of this thing we built?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours. It's not my thing any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to talk you out of it, am I cabron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll always be there for you Luis. Just pick up the phone, I'm there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna hold you to that. You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Enough of this sentimental bullshit. Next we'll be crying like two old women. Come on! One last drink, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours the liquor into the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the future. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tap glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bueno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shoot the liquor down. Fabio rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Business is all clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Don Luis a computer disc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No other copies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You even have to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs. Opens his arms. The two men embrace. Close as brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adios Marco. Make sure he doesn't get in too much trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adios Don Fabio. I'll do my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Fabio exits the garden. Don Luis watches him, sad to see his friend go. Sighs deeply, pours himsel a whiskey, downs it, turns to Marco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill this motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men, holding automatics in their laps sit in the back the driver in the front. They see Fabio very contained, calm, walking towards them. The driver turns the engine on. Fabio slips into the passenger seat. The car takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabio explodes. Smashes the dashboard. Over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fucker! The motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps banging the dash. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not OK Boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bastard thinks I'm an idiot. Playing it all mellow and shit. If he would have yelled and screamed and threatened to kill my whole family, it would have been OK. We have an hour to get out of here. At most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the nervous looks of the guys in the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabio's car comes to a screeching halt. Fabio exits to three other gunmen, nervous, on edge. The gunmen from the car take defensive positions. Fabio runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is still at the table drawing, when she hears the screeching of tires, the fast footsteps outside. She sens a storm coming. Fabio bursts in. His wife sees his tensio filled face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cataleya, go pack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm packed Mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is strangely calm, just sits at the table. Watches as Fabio takes the family picture off the wall, pries the frame back, extracts a small chip hidden inside the frame comes over to Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me my darling. Just in case of anything. This...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the chip up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your passport. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. He places the chip in her hand, takes a card out of his pocket. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find yourself alone? You go to the address on this card. Show it to the man at the front gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand papa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to understand. You just have to listen, and remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cat looks at the chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fabio's men keep a sharp lookout, two SUV's come rolli down the street. Their fingers work the triggers of their weapons. The two SUV's roll up. The blacked out windows roll down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (polite. smiling) Hola. We want to see Don Fabio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind if we wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabio writes on top of Cat's drawing, rips the page off, folds it, puts it in her pocket, removes a medal from aro his neck, drapes it over hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this will keep you safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks down at the medal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An imprint of a flower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cataleya orchid. It comes from one place on Earth. Our place. My mother, your grandmother, used to grow them. Every morning I would wake up to the sight of them. The smell of them. That's why I named you after them. It reminds us of who we are. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her on the forehead. His wife appears at the doorway with two suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the SUV is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said he's not home yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Puts his phone back in his pocket. Walks up to Fabio's men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change of plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out his gun, shoots them point blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they are exiting the house through a rear door, the shots ring out. They see another black SUV rushing up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes his family back inside. Fabio runs to the windo Sees his men on the losing end of a gun battle. As the men fall, and others run up the stairs firing as they retreat toward the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. Get ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mother drops the suitcases and runs to the rear room. Fabio comes over to the unnaturally calm Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too Papa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches under the table where Cat is sitting, takes a gun strapped there. Next to the gun is a big knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then footsteps, coming fast outside, draw his attenti 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alicia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife runs into the room toting two big assed assault rifles. She tosses one to Fabio. Both of them take up shooter's positions facing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at the table, very still. Watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing the front door, hands gripping their assault rifle sweat dripping down their faces, chests heaving, waiting, waiting, to blow anyone who comes through the door to kingdom come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they never get the chance because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine gun fire shatters the windows on both sides of th room, tearing into their bodies before they even get one shot off. Tearing the orchid plants there to shred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat watches in mute disbelief, shocked, as her parents bodies are riddled with heavy caliber rounds making them twitch and dance like marionettes on wires. Their blood splattering across the room, across her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Silence so complete it is deafening in it's absence of any sound. Cat just sits in her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the door bursts open and four gunmen storm into the room, their assault weapons trained on the only livin thing in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat. Marco enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in the kitchen. You, the bedroom. You, the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen scatter. Marco has his inquisitive eye on Cat, who does not drop her eyes, impossible to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the GUNMAN strides over to Cat, jams a gun to her head. Cat does not move a muscle. Does not blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Examines the frame Fabio dug the chip out of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chambers a round, is about to pull the trigger... 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the other gunmen begin to tear the house apart, lookin for something, Marco strides over to Cat. The frame in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis said kill everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also said no names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is about to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean so what? You take a kid, teach them, they have value.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman takes his gun, lifts Cat's lip, looks at her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't even get ten bucks for her in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman is about to pull the trigger again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you stupid or what? Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco hands him some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's twenty asshole. Go do your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scowling, the gunman joins the others in ripping the hous apart, looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco calmly goes to the fridge, takes out two bottles of water, cracks the caps, sets one down on front of Cat as he sits opposite her. Her hands are in her lap. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember me Cataleya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at your confirmation. My name is Marco, and I was a very good friend of your father. I see he gave you his medal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alluding to the medal around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cataleya orchid. His symbol. Your name. That's good. This way you will always remember him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this is a terrible thing for you to have seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the while his men are searching, frisking the bodies of the dead, even tearing the heels off their shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things are too complicated for a kid to understand. This is one of them. But I am going to try explain it and make it very simple for you. So you understand. Now, you know who Don Luis is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat responds, shakes her head yes. Her hand slips imperceptibly under the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touches the handle of the knife taped there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do. He was your father's best friend since they're kids. He's like an Uncle to you. You know he has always been good to your family, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again Cat shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This house, the food you eat, the clothes you wear. Even your school fees. All this comes from Don Luis. You know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again Cat shakes her head. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when someone is good to you and you are not good to them back, then bad things happen. Things like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He alludes to the riddled bodies of her dead parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks from the bodies and back to Marco, no emotion i her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you are a smart girl. You do well in school. So I know this is not too complicated for you to understand. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now, your father had something that belonged to Don Luis. A little thing. No bigger than...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up his thumbnail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This. Maybe it was in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the frame, shows where the chip was dug out o the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what I am talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gripping the knife handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. Do you know where it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you give it to me, Don Luis will be very grateful. And very generous. He will make sure that you are clothed, fed, and sent to the very best school. You will have everything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you don't give it to him, he will be very unhappy. And you see what happens when he is not happy, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why don't you just give that little thing which belongs to him. Will you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hesitates for a moment, and then removes one hand fro underneath the table, her fist closed tight. Marco smiles kindly. He holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a smart girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco opens his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in this life, smart girls get everything they want. What do you want Cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just as she is about to open her hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the table, gripping the handle of the knife taped there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me sweetheart...what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash, the knife is whipped out and buried into Marc unsuspecting, open palm. Driven with such force, the knif pierces through the back of his hand, and sticks into the table beneath; pinning his hand. Marco wants to scream but there is so much pain, nothing escapes his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in his ear) To kill Don Luis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men searching look up, and before they can react, Cat races past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she runs through the rooms of the house, sprints to th bathroom where one foot hits the toilet, springing her onto the ledge of a very small window. As she looks back, she sees the gunmen in hot pursuit. And she jumps, head first. Barely squeezing her small frame through the tiny window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she drops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six feet down, onto a ledge, that is just beneath the window. She flattens against the wall, holding onto the medal of her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the gunman comes to the window, cannot fit through looks out, does not see anybody across, then hears someth beneath him, looks down, sees the tip of a shoe below. Puts his gun out the window, points it down, and....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lets loose with a barrage from his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as the bullets split the cement all around he feet. Coming inches from ripping into them. And then the barrage stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His clip runs out. And as he fumbles to slam another one in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears the pause. Looks out over the sprawl of houses that stretch up and down the steep hillsides of the favel She looks down at her open palm at the small chip her fat gave her. Pops the chip in her mouth, swallows, leaps over the small divide between her house and the next roof and takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets the clip to fit, sees Cat heading off across the roo out in the open, exposed, vulnerable. He lifts his gun to shoot, when the gun muzzle is slammed up, peppers the ceiling with bullets. The gunman turns to Marco, holding his bloody rag wrapped hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need her alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat leaps from one rooftop to another, shinnies down a drain pipe onto another roof. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumping down from the window of Cat's home, start to spri across the roof in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops down to another roof, this one filled with a vegetable patch, where an old man is gardening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco exits Cat's house, wrapping his bloody hand tightly with a piece of his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He orders four more gunmen who have just zoomed up on motorcycles. The souped up rice rockets take off in four different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she comes off the last rooftop, down into a small alle She sprints across to a small door. She kicks at the door which gives way and enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a half dozen women are doing laundry by an open tap They look up to the sight of this little girl in the bloo splattered school uniform, do not say a word. And neither does Cat. She just runs through to a small gate on the far side of the courtyard, opens it, and disappears. One of the women casually hangs one of her wet sheets over th gate, hiding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crash through the vegetable garden. The old man deft kicks a rake leaning against the wall. It falls in betwee the rows of tomato vines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the gunmen sprint through, the first one trips over the rake, goes crashing through the vines, which causes the two men behind him to also trip and fall. The fourth man hurdles his fallen cohorts, bounds over the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the fifth man, looks at the old man. Knows what he has done. Shoots him dead before jumping off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She races down a steep hill in the crowded favela streets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the laundry yard. The women don't even look up. The gunmen look around, just see laundry hanging from the fence, do not see the hidden door. Race back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs down a steep alley, filled with people sitting outside their homes, chatting, playing dominoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the alley, two motorcycles appear. The ride see Cat, as she sees them. They turn their bikes into the alley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bear down on Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat sprints back up the hill. She goes to escape into one of the open doors, but she finds that one after another the doors have closed shut, the people fled inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bikes eat up the hill. Cat's legs are no match for them. It seems she will be caught any second. She ducks down a street where laundry is hung on a concealed metal pipe running the length of the alley. As Cat ducks throug the sheets the gunmen gun their bikes right towards her, tear through the sheets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back, to the dead gunmen, disappears over the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco, in an open top jeep, with three of his gunmen ON BOARD, comes rolling up the road. He sees Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep screeches around. Cat dashes down an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she runs up the alley with it's open sewers running on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alley is too narrow for the jeep. The men spill out, spring up the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alive! 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs up the alley, then ducks down another one. She comes to a ladder that leads up a fence, begins to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running up the alley, turning into the next one. Where they see the ladder. One of the gunmen pulls out his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the jeep, scouting as it rolls along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is running for all she is worth, out of breath, scare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More thugs on bikes, on foot, in cars. They are everywher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is leaning against a wall on a rooftop, gulping air, when she hears the roar of engines. Looks over the side of the building to see dozens of gunmen flooding the area

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climbing the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing them coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounding a building. Throwing grappling hooks onto the roof ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing the grappling hooks claw onto the roof edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cresting the roof from the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rappelling up the side of the building on the grappling ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flooding onto the roof from both sides. Coming to the spot where Cat was only moments before. To find no Cat. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the gunmen takes out his cell. Dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North! Go North! We're cutting off the southern streets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco slams his phone shut. Heads for his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen clear the roof. As the last one leaves, he takes one last suspicious sweep of the roof, cannot figur where this wisp of a girl went to. His eyes briefly focus on the chimney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clambers over the side of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, holding her breath, listening keenly to the sound of the men departing, is wedged into the chimney, her hands and feet clinging like a lizard to the walls on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes over the top of a hill, the soot of the chimney mingled with the blood of her parents, staining her dress The doors and windows all along the street are shuttered tight. Her eyes search the curb as she makes her way down the street. When she hears the sound of a vehicle. She looks up to a jeep turning the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the windshield of the jeep, staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got her! Close the net!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Marco. She pauses for a moment, and then does something that stuns even Marco. She starts to run right towards the jeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps sprinting toward the jeep. Another jeep appears over the hill behind her. Starts to come at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his jeep speeds right for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she runs, her eyes go to the right, and it becomes apparent she knows exactly what she is doing. She has a plan. And she executes it. Suddenly, she leaps for the curb and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees Cat dive to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she wriggles her skinny little body down the grate, with barely enough room to squeeze in. But in she does squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In total disbelief, watching her disappear down the narro slit in the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both jeeps pull up. The men jump out. Marco flattens to the street, peers into the grate, sees Cat staring up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco takes his gun out. Jams it in the grate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empties his clip into the dark. When he runs out of ammo, he peers down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is gone. The gunmen run to the next sewer grate fire into that one. Marco looks down, no Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen rip the grate out, jump down the hole. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen, following the beams of their flashlights, go tramping through the muck of the sewers, trying to find Cat. The only living things they find are rats, scurrying across their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks every car in the street in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen wait in the sewer, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO V.O.
dialogues.text: Come back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen retreat back the way they came. They do not see someone watching them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small crevice in the sewer wall. Cat has squeezed herse into the crack, almost invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars and trucks rumble along a busy thoroughfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand emerges. And then, Cat pulls herself out, into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands at the edge of the busy thoroughfare, and look around. She is in the heart of the city. Where tall offic buildings, compete with graceful, classical mansions. In the distance, she sees the hillsides, covered with the twinkling lights of the favelas, two miles, and a world away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Marines stand guard. Looking straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marine looks down to Cat. Bedraggled, covered in soot and blood and shit. Holding out the card her father gave her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American looks at the card Cat gave to the Marine, hands it to another American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you say you have something for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Cat, who nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat takes a beat. Puts her fingers down her throat. And throws up all over the man's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh jeez...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches into the goop on the desk and comes up with the chip. She hands it over to the man behind the desk, who takes a handkerchief out and takes it from her, gingerly. He looks at the chip, looks at Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facts, figures, names, dates, a wealth of information scrolls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to record this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat does not understand. The second American hits a butto on a remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Papa. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is your Papa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he tell you what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...my passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat watches out the window as the plane's landing gear drops and the city of Miami spreads out before her in all it's shimmer and glistening glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are making our final approach to Miami International airport. Please fasten your seat belts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down at the medal around her neck. A tear forms in her eye. Rolls down her cheek. Impossible to tell if it is a tear of joy or sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, with a plastic envelope holding her travel documents around her neck, accompanied by an airline rep, walks dow the jetway toward the entrance to the airport, where a MA is standing. Looking directly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the passengers are filing to the left as they leave the jetway, but as Cat and her escort approach the man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat stands in front of a rotund bureaucrat, with the man who escorted her, handing over her passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bureaucrat looks at her passport. As Cat glimpses through the slatted window looking out over the Customs floor, where all the other passengers are being processed in long lines. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have done something pretty important to get the royal treatment little lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat says nothing. He stamps her passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks at him, not sure if this is good news or bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks out the window of the car at the skyline passin by, silent, filled with wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks at him, doesn't respond. He turns the radio on. A god awful C&W song comes on. Cat looks at him for a moment, then reaches over, turns the radio off. Goes back to looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car passes a gate with a sign: MISS PORTERS SCHOOL FO GIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been our mission statement since we first opened our doors in nineteen twenty three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To provide a safe, healthy nurturing environment where young women can get the education they will need to meet the challenges of that amazing adventure called life. How does that sound to you, my dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat does not respond, she just stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a long day for her. Here's the check for the year's tuition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands over a check. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the five hundred dollars allowance for the first six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands over a wad of bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which we keep right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She places the money in an envelope with Cat's name on it and puts the envelope into a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give you twenty a week for incidentals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands a twenty to Cat. Who takes it without saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we say darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three dozen girls of all ages go about their business. Some do homework on their beds, others do their hair, dan run around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly, at the sound of a door opening, they all stop and look in the same direction at Cat and the MONITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls, this is your new classmate. Please welcome her and show her the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up is at seven. Sweet dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits. All the girls stare at Cat. No one makes a move. In the silence, you can hear a pin drop, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biggest girl in the dorm, a head taller than everyone and twenty pounds heavier, with bully written all over he face, saunters down the aisle right towards Cat. Her name is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sherri. And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls all around twitter. Sherri looks back at them, no good rising on her smirking face. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, 'very tired', I'm sure you want to lay down and rest your little head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points halfway down the aisle to an empty bed. Cat is about to walk towards it, when Sherri puts a beefy hand i her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's gonna cost you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks at Sherri. Looks at the other girls all hanging on every word, waiting to see what jumps off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat considers, then reaches into her jumper and extracts the twenty dollars the headmisstress gave her. Hands it over to Sherri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week. Peace has it's price, y'know what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat says nothing, just stares at Sherri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we clear on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty dollars a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherri opens her sweatshirt to reveal a fanny pack. She unzips it, puts Cat's twenty in with a wad of other twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a smart one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other girls hoot and whistle. Sherri removes her hand from Cat's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat still says nothing. She walks up the aisle past all the other girls, who remain silent. It is only after Cat has laid down on her bed, that the laughing and twitterin resumes. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat stares at the ceiling, her hand reaches inside her jumper, takes out the medal her father gave her. She hold it close in her hand, just lays that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the girls are asleep in their beds. Silence reigns, except for the small cries and sighs of girls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes still open, her hand clutching her father's meda She gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat makes her way down the hall. At the end of the Hall is a door marked EXIT. But she is not looking at the exit she is looking for something else. And she finds it. A door marked: HEADMISTRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat tries the door, it is locked. She takes her father's medal from around her neck, and uses it to pop the lock. Looking left and right to make sure the coast is clear, she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat tries the drawer where the Headmistress locked her money away. She looks around, takes a letter opener off the desk, pops the drawer, extracts the envelope with her name on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again Cat walks down the darkened hall, looking for anoth door. Finds it marked: INFIRMARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat walks along the cabinets containing the pharmaceutica until she finds what she is looking for. She smashes the glass door, reaches in, extracts one bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, with four belts slung over her shoulder, the bottle from the infirmary in one in one hand, a cloth in the oth stands over the sleeping Sherri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat pours the contents of the bottle out into the cloth. Seals the bottle. Puts it down. Then takes the cloth and places it over Sherri's sleeping face, ever so gently. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun comes up over the horizon, casts it's first rays through the windows of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hits the faces of the girls. As they wake, they find two very interesting things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1. A twenty dollar bill on each bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2. Sherri fast asleep, her hands and feet tied to the pos of the bed with belts, her shirt pulled up, her money bel gone. And the word THIEF written in magic marker across her stomach. And the drawing of the Cataleya orchid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kind faced Hispanic woman, a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola chica, where are we wanting to go today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, barely up to the window, hands the ticket agent the piece of paper her father gave her. The woman looks at the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicago is not next door, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat holds up the envelope from the headmistresses office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landscape of America passes by through the window of bus. Clutching a new Lara Croft comic, nibbling on a big Mac and fries out of a bag, Cat sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sugar cane harvests in the Florida wetlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two big fat black women sitting on the porch of a shack shelling peas in the deep South.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Steel Mills of Pittsburgh fire up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The endless expanse of corn and wheat stretching from horizon to horizon across Ohio. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant milk barns of Indiana with their hundreds of cows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally, sees the great city of Chicago looming in th distance as the bus hurls down the highway towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As seedy as any bus terminal. People bustling, people hustling. A veritable cauldron of humanity bubbling with the good, the bad, the ugly. The predators and the prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat exits into this stew of life, looks around, checks things out. As she is checked out in turn by some pretty sleazy types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat ignores the eyes following her, walks up to a dwarf hawking newspapers. Hands him her slip of paper. He point her in a direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat walks across the neighborhoods of Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees the signs in Polish change into signs in Italian, in Spanish, Chinese, Ethiopian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands her paper to an Ethiopian cabbie. He points her onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks past bars where black gangbangers watch her pas She hands one her paper, he points her on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks past massive churches, synagogues, mosques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks past the stately houses of the Gold Coast, alon the deserted stretches of the glam shops on Michigan Aven over the bridges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until she comes to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The denizens of this world look every bit as dangerous as they are. Gangbangers, con artists, trouble waiting to happen at every turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, walking down the block as the eyes of everyone she passes follow her. She stops on a street corner. Seems lost. Opposite her a group of men, hanging outside a bar see her. The leader of the group calls her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kid. You know what time it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat shakes her head. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late, and this is not the kind of place a kid should be hanging out. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hands him her paper. He looks at her, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cataleya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man takes a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disappears up a small alley into the darkness beyond. Cat, not knowing what to do, sits down on the curb, watch street life. She sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hookers soliciting men in passing cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops sitting in a patrol car, bored, blase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men playing craps against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some very discreet dope deals, more sleight of hand than anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very bloodied face. Once, twice, three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILIO RESTREPO, 35, a hard case, fuck with me at your ow risk written all over his face, is about to deliver anoth crushing blow to a poor soul strapped to a chair when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beating stops, Emilio turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a girl looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in a girl right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the task at hand. Cocks his fist. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that sort of thing. She's eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Emilio stops. The man hands her Cat's paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says her name's Cataleya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This focuses Emilio's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is sitting watching the street, when a pair of legs appear in front of her. Cat looks up to the man who disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns abruptly, heads back up the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat follows the man through a darkened alley. At interval on either side, dangerous looking men, armed to the teeth stand in the shadows. The man opens a door, beckons Cat to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat follows the man as he moves down a long hallway. Cat looks into the rooms on either side of the hall as she walks along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one room, opening out to a trucking bay, TV sets are being unloaded into a big warehouse full of stolen merchandise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In another room, guns are being serviced. Lots of guns, hand guns, assault rifles. Big artillery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's attention is drawn away from the room with the guns to the Man holding a door open for her at the very end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat enters an office with three women working on computer Looks like any other business office. At the sight of Cat, the women get up and exit, closing the door behind them. Cat is left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around the office, when the sound of a door opening behind her. She turns to Emilio. Who approaches her cautiously, scrutinizing her. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cataleya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it is Cat who hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Emilio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio covers his mouth, seems rocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madonna! I thought you were dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat stands stock still. Emilio takes her up in his arms, lifts her, crushes her to his chest. Cat remains suspende emotionless for a moment. And then, for the first time emotion, real emotion, washes across her face. Her lower lip begins to tremble. Tears well up in her eyes. She bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're safe now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the emotion, the fear, the anger that she has kept locked away deep inside, rushes to the surface in one massive wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun peeks over the horizon, spreading the fog infused light coming off Lake Michigan across the sleeping city a it ascends in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One beam of sunlight slips through the narrow crack betwe a window and the shade covering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ray of sunlight washes across Cat's sleeping face. She wakes slowly. Her eyes open after a long sleep. For a moment she does not remember where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks around the clean, orderly bedroom as she gather her thoughts. Her eyes move around the room. It is a boy's room. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With models of soldiers, futuristic warriors, a big poste of Al Pacino as Tony Montana in SCARFACE. A poster with every imaginable type of assault rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio sits reading the financial section of the morning paper over what seems to be the remains of a very hearty breakfast. An elderly woman, grandmotherly, fills his coffee cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracias mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noise turns both of them to the doorway and Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenos diaz Cara. Come. Sit. I'll make you some eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama caresses her face, her eyes glisten with a grandmother's love. Kisses her on the forehead, lovingly, whispers into her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your mother's beautiful eyes. Don't be scared. This is your home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, hesitantly, Cat makes her way across the kitchen to the table, where she sits opposite Emilio, tentative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you slept?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. A long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well good. A growing body needs sleep. When I was your age I would sleep half the day. I don't know if it helped with the growing, but I was well rested for whatever came after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose room is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son. Your cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice holds anger, not sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one who is still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama comes over, puts a plate of eggs in front of her. As she begins to wolf down the food. He holds up the page of her drawing, the one her Father put his address on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are very talented. Is this what you want to be? An artist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to want to be like Lara. A super agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoveling more food into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chewing, Cat shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) I want to be a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps shoveling food in her mouth. Emilio looks up at his mother, who crosses herself. Cat finishes the last mouthful, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio blinks once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio walks Cat down the street. He is carrying a kids book bag. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good news is your father bought you your life with what he gave you. The bad news is Don Luis was playing both sides, and has disappeared. You tore down everything he spent years building up with that little chip. It is something he will not forget. There is a law in this thing of ours. If someone does you, the revenge goes all the way down the line. Women, children, Grandmothers, dogs, cats. No exceptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to scare me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am trying to educate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRINCIPAL watches Emilio count the money out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally we don't accept students in the middle of the academic year, but under the circumstances, losing her parents in that tragic car accident...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks out the window, saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands a list over to Cat. Who keeps looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the school supplies you'll need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio takes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still in a bit of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. See you Monday Cataleya. Such a pretty name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps looking out the window. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Emilio walks along, with Cataleya, reading the list of supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get all this stuff, then go over to this little place I know down on Maxwell street for some of these hot dogs the Polish people make here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns left at the cross street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like hot dogs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down, sees no Cat. Looks back to see Cat walking in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries, catches up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already been to school. I told you what I want to be. You don't want to help me, fine. I'll do it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off. Emilio grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chica. Any idiot can be a killer. Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio draws a .357 magnum pistol from his shoulder holst and empties the entire clip into the front of a car comin down the street. The car careens off the road, smashes a fire hydrant, crashes through a plate glass window of a shop across the street. The water from the hydrant shoot twenty feet in the air. Emilio holsters his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to teach you to be a killer? No problema. I'll teach you. But you'll be dead in five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to be a killer, and survive, you have to be a smart one. You have to know things besides how to pull a trigger. You have to know how the world works. How people think. You got to learn to be psychological. That I cannot teach you, unless you learn the basics at school. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what's it going to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out the gun in one hand, and the schoolbag in th other. Cat hesitates for a moment. Takes the schoolbag from Emilio. Then takes his hand, and they walk off together as police sirens announce the arrival of cruiser and people pour out of the school and the surrounding stores. As they put distance between the chaos and themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I still want to be a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleepy California town on the way to nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police cruiser sits on a quiet street, right off a wide avenue. Main street. There is no traffic either way. The nose of the cop car juts out just off the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cops are sitting, peeling back the wrappers on their burgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then I suggest, y'know, we buy some things to spice it up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Define things. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they nibble and talk, they pay scant attention to a se of headlights coming up the broad avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A garter belt, some of those stockings that come up the thigh...it's fourteen years. Know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights come closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. No matter how much you like steak, sometime a lamb chop is not a bad thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights shine right into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only then, when the lights are directly on them, do the cops turn to see a car heading right toward their front end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front end of the cop car gets sheared right off by th impact. Glass shatters, metal crunches, airbags explode!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other car. The drivers door opens. A vodka bottle falls out, clinks to the sidewalk. And a moment later, two legs emerge from the car. Two very long, very shapely legs. Legs that never end. In very high heels, and a very short mini skirt. And the face on top of it, framed by a mane of wild hair, is drop dead think-you-have-died- and-gone-to-heaven gorgeous. The whole package reads SUPERMODEL. And by the way she is weaving when she stands and the bottle at her feet, the read is; very drunk supermodel. Who looks at the crumpled police cruiser, looks into the windshield of the cruiser at the stunned cops, and says in the most sweetly drunk voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops can't believe this. They regain their wits and bolt out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you have to say? Oops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, ever so sensually, she starts to laugh. The cops look at each other, perplexed. And she keeps laughing. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops get pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and she keeps laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna laugh you crazy bitch? I'll give you something to laugh about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And even when they slam her to the hood of the car, jam her hands behind her back, and slap the cuffs on, she kee laughing, and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet night in the small station. Cat stands in front of the booking desk, so drunk the two cops have to hold her up. A surveillance camera over the desk innocuously records everything. Cat keeps her head down, her face, obscured by her mane of hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the SERGEANT goes through her purse, finds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No license, no registration. No ID except a library card. Well Ms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reads off the library card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valarie Phillips in addition to all that...you're being charged here with DUI, destruction of police property, driving the wrong way on a two way street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you can think of anything else you should be charged with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing no panties? 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant and the arresting cops holding her up give her a long look, as do any of the other cops in ear shot, whose eyes go to her very short skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank goodness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she teeters over, passes out cold right on the Sergeant's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her in the back, lock her up, put a cup of coffee in with her. Let her sleep it off, we'll book her tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cops who booked her drag her out. As they do, the Sergeant and the two other cops on duty lean over to try and get a look up her very long legs and her very short skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three black SUV's, with blacked out windows, come rolling up to the station. The doors open and a dozen U.S. MARSHA jump out. Vigilant, forming a cordon around one of the vehicles, out of which comes a hand cuffed, kevlar wearin hard as nails MAFIA type. GENNARO RIZZO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshal's surround him, guns bristling, on the look out for any danger, and hustle him towards the doors of the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station doors slam open. Marshal's barge in. The HEAD MARSHAL approaches the surprised Sergeant on the des flashes his credentials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: US Marshal Warren. We have Gennaro Rizzo here on an overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo. The Mafia guy? On the way to testify up in San Francisco tomorrow? They didn't notify you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rifles through some papers. Finds one. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. Says here you're not expected until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never expect the expected Sergeant. (to his men) Secure this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshals come down the cell block, checking everythin out. They pass Cat in her cell, passed out cold, her long legs and short skirt slows their progress a bit. After a long look, they move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo is pushed into a cell. The door is slammed and locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One man here. Two more outside the front door. Everyone else on the perimeter, in teams of two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands out thermos bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a caffeine kinda night fellas. Eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone cop passes Cat's cell, doing the nightly rounds. As soon as he is gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's eyes snap open. She sits up, moves with the efficiency and determination of someone who has not has a drop of alcohol. She takes a spoon from the coffee cup left for her, reaches into her mane of hair and extracts small pin. She inserts the pin into the keyhole of the door, jiggles it. The door pops open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat exits the cell, takes a broom leaning in the corner, and keeping her eye on the camera above the door, she sli along the wall, until she is just under the camera. She uses the broom handle to tilt the camera up just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One lone cop sits in front of the various monitors. He does not notice that one tilts slightly up, points toward a blank wall. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, under the camera, unlocks the second door, slips out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes into the hall where several vending machines lean against the wall. On the far side is a door marked: ELECTRICAL. She is about to head for it, when she hears a door open at the far end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end of the hall. A cop comes in, looks down the hall. Where Cat was standing he sees only the vending machines. He heads right for the machines. Puts coins in the machine, waits for his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Cat is pressed hard against the flat surface, inche from the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sandwich falls, the cop retrieves it, moves off, exit down the hall. Cat waits until she hears the door shut on the far end of the wall. She crosses quickly to the door across the way, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revealing the electrical control panel for the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat stands on a narrow shelf, undoes the last screws on a vent in the ceiling with a screwdriver from the tool boar on one wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat drops down, opens the electrical control panel on the wall, studies it for a moment, finds the switch she is looking for, then turns to the wall of tools, plucks some wire, a cutter, a spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat sets to work on a jury rigged mechanism with the item at hand. When she is finished, she tugs at the waist band of her mini skirt, and little by little she stretches a thin dun colored leotard suit over her whole body. She takes a small plastic vial, fills it with some water from the tap, and sets it, just so, above the device she has constructed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The device is hooked to the switch she selected, a small weight hangs from the bottom of it by a wire. She sets the water container just so over the spoon from her cell. The water begins to drip a drop at a time. She closes the panel door, sets her digital watch. Hoists herself up to the vent in the ceiling, and is gone. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water dripping into the spoon a drop at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once inside the grate, Cat takes one of the buttons off her blouse and presses the top of it. The button becomes a pin light, which she clasps between her teeth, starts t crawl on her stomach, pulling herself along by her elbows and her wriggling hips and knees, the light still between her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she moves through the maze of ducts. On the way, she peers through the grates in each ceiling, down into one cell after another, catching various views of inmates asl as she passes over them. Until she comes to a ventilation fan blocking the way. The fan blades go round and round. Cat looks at her watch, looks at the fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Cat's jury rigged device. The water has almost filled the spoon, one more drop, one more drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The digital counter goes from 4 to 3 to 2 to 1...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last drop of water drips into the spoon, the spoon tips, tugging on the wire, the wire trips the switch it i connected to, the whole device comes apart, the separate pieces fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fan stops. The blades slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sergeant at the desk hears the ventilation system go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Doyle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls to one of the other cops on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go take a look at the breaker on the ventilation system, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle moves off. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat watches the blades of the vent fan slow. When they have completely stopped she starts to move herself throug the very narrow space between the now stilled blades, fee first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle enters the room, opens the electrical panel. The spoon, the weight, the spring, and the wire, fall to the floor. Doyle looks at them curiously for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is half way through the fan blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks at the switches, going down the printed list on the door, trying to locate the right one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is almost through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle finds the switch that corresponds to the ventilatio system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's neck passes through the fan blades. Slow going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle hits the switch for the ventilation system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is just through, when the blades start moving, brush against her forehead, as she makes it to the other side with no time, and no room to spare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes to a vent, looks down, begins to loosen the ven screws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat drops down into a bathroom. Looks at her watch. Sits down, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo is asleep in his cell. The Marshal on duty finishes his coffee. Looks at Rizzo. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then walks over to the door at the end of the wall. He hits a buzzer on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop manning the bank of monitors, wakes up, sees the Marshal in the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor hits a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door buzzes open. The Marshal passes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshal pushes the bathroom door open. Enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshal finishes peeing, zips himself up. Turns. Right into a devastating reverse wheel kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop on duty hears a buzz, looks up to the bank of monitors, and sees the Marshal standing at the door. Thinking nothing of it, he hits the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, propping the unconscious Marshal up, hides behind him. As the door buzzes, she maneuvers the body around, pushes through. On the other side, she drops the body, and takes his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor it looks like the Marshal is passing throu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo is half asleep, when the barrel of a gun taps him o the head. He opens his eyes slowly to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbutton your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo looks over to where the Marshal is passed out cold on the floor. He does as he is told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not room service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pumps four bullets into his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four shots reverberate throughout the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two patrols of two Marshal's each hear the shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops and Marshal's, guns drawn, come running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knocked out Marshal comes to. Finds a gun in his hand Doesn't get it, until he looks over to see Rizzo, with hi face blown off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open and the Marshal's and cops come pouri through, to find the Marshal with the gun in his hand and the dead Rizzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshal is frozen, totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it, Joe!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More guns. More confusion. Tension beyond the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it! 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshal drops his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call a bus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks through the vent over the cell. Sees the wobbly confused Marshal with the gun in his hand, hears feet com fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes climbing out of a ventilation duct onto the roo She looks out over the side of the building. Marshal's stationed outside are running into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are cuffing the Marshal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys! I didn't do it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance on the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Marshal is checking Rizzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search the place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is running as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops and Marshals are running through every room, checkin everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches another air vent, so about to pry it off when she hears... 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops running up the stairs, headed for a door above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hears the door begin to open. She bangs her high heel together. And two blades come out of the front. She sees the door knob turning. She runs for the roof's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops burst through the door to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops pour onto the roof, looking around, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
