dialogues.text: Clinging to the wall like a gekko. The dun colored wall blending with her dun colored suit. How is she doing this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blades fitted into the seam between the bricks. Her fingertips clinging to the small lip on the bottom of the roof's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops look around the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds there listening to the noise above. Hears noise below, looks down to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops searching the alley below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging to the edge of the building. Listening, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops, finding nothing, head back out the door. A mome later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's hand reaches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When one hand has a firm grasp on the roof ledge, she let go with the other hand and grasps the ledge, extracts the blades from the brick seams, and swings herself up on the roof. As her shoes dislodge, some mortar comes loose and falls below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crumbling mortar falls on the head of one cop, he loo down, sees the crumbly gravel, looks up, sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat lands on the roof, lays still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He examines the gravel, looks up again. And then moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat pries the vent cover off, slips in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops are checking every cell in the men's block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is crawling along as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops come to the entrance of the woman's cell block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes to the vent in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops open the door to the women's cell block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat runs. Begins to pull at her leotard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops look at the women's cells, heading right toward Cat's. As they reach Cat's, the same cop who did the roun at the beginning of the night looks into her cell. Cat is laying on her side, away from them, dead asleep, in the same position she was when the cop first checked on her. The cops pause for a moment, then move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are wide open. She listens for the outer door closing, and then she breathes out, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance pulls up, along with the Marshal contingent in their SUV's. The Marshal's spill out of the SUV's as a gurney with a corpse is wheeled into the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Marshal's stand around, the Police Coroner begins to unbutton the shirt of Rizzo the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Rizzo's chest the word TRAITOR is written in thick bla letters. And above them, a drawing of the Cataleya orchid The Marshal's knows what this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Call Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of a small jet opens and MARCUS ROSS, 48, a keen eyed, no nonsense all business FBI agent, followed by a team of similarly focused men and women, exits down the stairs to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Ross?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters are gathered, trying to gain access. The police are keeping them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the clamor of reporters outside, Cat is just finishi with her finger printing, wipes off as much of the ink as she can. The Sergeant hands over her library card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't drink. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to the judge at your hearing in ten days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alluding to all the commotion she sees through the window looking out into the main room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Fill out the forms and you can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. We need to get things organized. But don't worry, the judge will send you back, for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a sheaf of papers and a pen. As the pen hits the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross, with his team standing off his shoulder, looks down at the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same handwriting. Same flower. It's him. Let's see the location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hands the paper work over to the sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky no one was hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have never forgiven myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping her back to the security camera overhead, Cat collects her things and exits. As the door closes... 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross exits the SUV to the crowd of reporters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Rizzo? Was it an assassination? Are there any clues? Is it true a Marshal did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross sees cops coming and going from the station. He turn to the Marshal with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't lock it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was after the fact. I didn't think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross cannot believe what he is hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Now. No one in or out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exiting the station. Ross and his team sweep past her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK! That's it. No one in or out! Lock down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat just keeps walking, right past Ross, who heads into the station as the cops try to keep the reporters at bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking away from the pandemonium she is leaving behind. As it recedes over her shoulder, she picks at her fingers where the fingerprinting ink has stained them. Her prints come off! She drops the fake prints down a sewer and keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross scrutinizes Rizzo's cell as his team takes prints, photos, sweeps the cell for evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see paper on everyone in and out of the station in the last twenty four hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to the end of the hall. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want the tapes from the security cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat extracts a knapsack from the locker, heads for the woman's bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat tugs at her hair. The wild mane comes off to reveal her straight hair, which she pulls back in a pony tail. She begins to strip out of her mini skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat dressed in jeans, a scuffed leather jacket, a basebal cap, with the brim pulled low over her eyes, with her pon tail sticking out of the back, the knap sack on her shoulder, waits on line to board the bus. She keeps her back to the security camera, has her phone to her ear. A number is ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio, fifteen years older, is watching a soccer game, picks up the phone. In the kitchen, Mama is cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat moves up the line to board the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning after OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't wait to see you Cara. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over to Mama at the stove, who waves over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama says hello back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, goes back to his game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat boards the bus. The doors close behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the camera ZOOMS up, and the bus pulls out onto the road...

dialogues.speaker: ROSS V.O.
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is pointing up at the camera Cat tilted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tilted the camera just enough so the angle would catch the guard, not who was holding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to his team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty two murders in four years all with the same M.O. The word, the flower. He's sending a message, for sure. And I'm beginning to think it's not to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're the only ones with the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're not getting anywhere with it, are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one on the team can dispute this. It occurs to Ross...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the message is not for us, let's make sure the one it's intended for gets it. I want you to put it out to the press. Splash it across every newspaper, every magazine. National. I want eyeballs on it coast to coast. Monitor it. Let's see if anything comes back. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Lincoln town car comes down the leafy, quiet street of well kept homes. Stops at a gate guarded by two men, who wave him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car ends up in front of a very impressive house, whic sits at the end of a long driveway. Toward the era of the walled property, a garage, and a guest house. MR. RICHARD in a suit and tie, looking like a proper mid level government official, or a lawyer, exits, newspaper in han As he approaches the front door, Richard looks over to se two more guards, off to the side. He nods to them, knows them. They nod back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard approaches the front door, knocks. While he is waiting, he looks down at the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Richard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard looks up to a fifteen year older Marco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it has Marco. How's the hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco holds up his scarred hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only hurts when it's humid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've let us relocate you to Arizona instead of New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boss likes it humid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard enters. The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis stares out a bay window, drink in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Luis. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Mr. Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you the morning paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the paper up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coincidence? Twenty two times? A flower that only grows in one place on earth? That used to be the calling card of...what was his name? Your former partner? The one who did your wet work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabio. Fabio Maria Restrepo. But I don't understand? Why come here with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because when we find the end of a string we like to know where it begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: String? Now we are talking about string? I'm not a tailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis. Let's cut to the chase here, OK? When the Agency extracted your ass from Colombia fifteen years ago, and set you up here, we let you resume your business when what we should have done was lock you up for life. In exchange, you were supposed to keep the information flowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, and not for a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is what you traveled all the way down here to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What I traveled all the way down here to tell you, is there's a limit to our patience. The CIA is not an amusement park. There are no free rides. Everyone pays their way. And you, my friend, have not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK OK. What would you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps the newspaper down with the picture of Rizzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had nothing to do with this. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then find out who does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he goes to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Don Luis, don't play the innocent with us. It won't sit well with my bosses if we find out you had anything to do with this. Have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard walks to his car, observed by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's talking to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis reaches out, fast as a Cobra, grabbing Marco by the lapel, pulling him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiot! I told you. Everyone dead. Down to the dog.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You screwed up the first time. Now go fix it. Find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she finds us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat steps off the bus. Looks around to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The total full on crush of people that a major metropolit bus terminal holds. She sees a surveillance camera tucked in a corner. She pulls the brim of her hat low over her eyes, takes off into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes to a non descript high rise. She enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat enters a completely bare bones dwelling, there is nothing that identifies the person who lives here. White bare walls, a table with one chair, a single bed. Along one wall, a cabinet. On the window sill a single Cataleya orchid. Cat waters the orchid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat opens the cabinet to three computer screens. Two of them are divided into quarters and show various views of the building entrance, the lobby, the stairway, the elevator, the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third screen is dark, until Cat hits a button and mus fills the apartment. Music with a heavy sensual back beat French Rap. Ooh la la. And the screen pulses and glows in time to the beat. Cat's body responds to the music, moving sexy, her shoulders rolling, her hips swaying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat sashays across the open space, a stripper strutting her stuff; shedding, first her blouse, then her jeans, he lingerie, until, by the time she reaches a free standing opaque cylinder of a shower with an opaque shower curtain she is completely nude. She enters the shower. Turns on the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a snake shedding a skin, she lets the water divest her of everything that came before.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS V.O.
dialogues.text: Since each and every one of the victims was a professional bad apple...

dialogues.speaker: ROSS V.O.
dialogues.text: We've narrowed motive down to payback or preemptive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross has just pinned up Rizzo's picture on a wall filled with twenty two other deceased, all with words and a CATALEYA ORCHID imprint on their stomach's. He turns to face his team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to Rizzo on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most recent, was done to keep him from talking. Alexa Milshinova...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points to a gorgeous dead woman with the word GRIFTER on her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...made a career of getting intimate with big stakes gamblers out of Vegas and then taking them off and sending them to meet their maker. D'Angelo James...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points to a huge black man with USURPER written in white letters across his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tried to take over the heroin trade in Houston from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to two Mexicans, identical twins, one with PAY written on his chest, the other with the word BACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gemini cartel. Their crimes are self explanatory, if you can read. Now I know some of you are thinking whoever is doing this makes less work for mother. And since there's no collateral damage, why are we wasting valuable manpower and resources on the case? And since until now, there has never been a clue to go on, why go on? But with this last killing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a stack of folders from his desk. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have one. As we go to the video tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a button and the video replay of Cat walking the unconscious guard through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't see the assassin, but we can see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freezes the tape. Points to the time mark on the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time. 2 AM. Which means our perp was in the station at...I don't have to spell it out for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to hand the folders out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the names, phone numbers and addresses of everyone with a pulse who entered that police station before two AM. Cops, criminals, clerks, janitors. Everyone. One of them is our target. I want each of you to locate the ten people in the folder you've been given. I want a complete dossier on every one of them for the last ten years of their lives. Run down every lead. Check out every story. Our killer is out there. And we're going to find him. Before he kills again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an elevator train rumbles by below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elevator train rumbles by above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car parking. And DANNY DELANEY, preoccupied, a pleasant easy going, good looker at 28, closes the door, and walks to the entrance of his low slung apartment building. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny puts his key in the door, finds that it is unlocked He pauses, then enters. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny enters his darkened apartment. Goes to turn on the switch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny's hand freezes. He stands very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. To darkness. And then, a match is struck, a candle is lit. Standing before him, in garters, thigh highs, a very sexy bra, and fuck me pumps is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat closes to an inch of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have been out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have been late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to kiss him, lightly around the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps kissing him, lightly on the neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You show up whenever you want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we have the most incredible sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm just saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fumbles for the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you like to go to dinner sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps nibbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. This taste good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Licking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They put me to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's pop in a DVD and you can spend the night here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. Looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like the key back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just want to get...I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She resumes nibbling on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her nails down his chest, slowly, teasing. Her hand finds his groin. What she finds makes her smile. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this close enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gently lowers his hands to his sides, holds them ther Kisses him deeply. Pushes him down onto the floor. And lowers herself on top of him. A small moan escapes his lips as she takes him inside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny wakes. His face holds the smile of the memory of the night before. He turns his head, lazily. The pillow beside him is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is gone. Danny's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio walks down the stairs, carrying a shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK WITH HIM ALONG THE STREET. Until he comes to a Laundromat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio loads laundry from the shopping bag into a machine puts in the coins, then sits down on a bench to watch the cycle. Seems to talk to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we see he is talking to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my end. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio takes a manila envelope out of the bag. Places it on the seat next to him. Cat picks it up, looks through it. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember the guy who was in the news for running that Ponzi scheme about a year ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cover features WILLIAM WOOGARD, 45, the most unassumi baldheaded, pudgy faced man, a nerd. Under the headline: PREDATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disappeared fifty billion dollars. The money was never recovered. Skipped out and bought himself citizenship on some shit hole of a Caribbean island that calls itself a country with no extradition laws. Lot of very pissed off people lost everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat goes to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps the newspaper down with Rizzo's picture on the front page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has this been going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paper says twenty two. All like this. Tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you're a kid, you don't do anything for no reason. Don't play dumb, it insults me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she goes to rise, Emilio grabs her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just you in this. It's me, Mama. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tio. You're removed. You book the work, you collect the fees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watch your ass. Each and every job, I vet, I double vet. For every one I book you, I turn down five, ten. I promised to keep you safe. I KEEP YOU SAFE. Cataleya. It's a full time job, no matter what you think. Those pictures...they freaked me out. OK? I didn't realize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come to you at nine. I say I want to be a killer. What kind of kid makes a career choice like that unless they have something on their mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live for the day that the blood of the son of bitch who did my parents drips in the gutter. Stop playing the innocent with me. You know this. Forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Of course. But the way you're playing it. They even have a name for you. The Tag killer. I would have stopped it a long time ago. Had I known about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat smiles. A smile that could melt ice in winter. But a knowing smile. A 'Don't bullshit a bullshitter' smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do, you would never have let me get involved in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth of her words deprive him of his. She kisses him him on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she exits, leaving Emilio more concerned. He looks down at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is at his computer, staring at the screen and the orchid, alongside a map of Colombia and the specific regi where the Cataleya is found. He thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Let's try...organization...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He types. Data comes up. And what he sees stuns him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A folder marked CIA: CONFIDENTAL. ACCESS DENIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ramshackle warehouse, it's windows streaked opaque with years of dust and grime, surrounded by a fence, and a wee garden which is home to dozens of the most unique wind chimes of all sizes and shapes, made from scrap metal. And two of the biggest, most ferocious dogs on Earth, lay on their sides, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog's ears perk up; hearing something we don't, a low growl begins to rumble deep in their throats. The gate to the garden begins to open, and like a shot the dogs are up, hurling themselves toward the opening gate, eyes flashing, barking loud enough to scare the dead back to life, fangs bared, ready to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they stop cold when they see who it is coming into their domain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding two very full shopping bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the dogs jump all over her, licking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pets them, plays with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. OK. Now sit. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs obey her in a heartbeat, sitting expectantly. Not making a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's see what good boys you can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches into one of the shopping bags, pulls out two roasts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top cut sirloin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which she puts down on the ground. The dog's eyes go to the chunks of meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs can barely contain themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, juicy, delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs whimper in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the shopping bags, and heads for the ramshac warehouse. The dogs moan, but do not move, their eyes going from the meat to Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches the door. Turns. Sees the dogs looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs pounce. Each one grabs a roast and tears into the meat with ferocious, pent up glee. Cat smiles at the sight, enters the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warehouse, is filled with piles of rusting scrap meta the cannibalized carcasses of cars, trucks, shipping containers, welding equipment, hammers tongs, all sorts o tools. In the corner is one fully built truck, a big red monster with huge demolition fenders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is home to OLD PEPE, an ancient, blind man, who is working away, building yet another set of oversized chime out of scrap metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola Cataleya. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola Pepe. I guess the boys gave me away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else? The barking would only have stopped when their screaming began. You spoil them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I train them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
