dialogues.text: Can we talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls on her top. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already talked. I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slips into her shoes. Does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she heads for the door, she turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know something else about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with a small smile, she is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside Danny's door, Cat crosses to the elevator, waits for it to come. As she does, she fixes her clothes a bit, her eyes on Danny's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come out. Please. Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door doesn't open. The elevator arrives. She takes a deep breath, enters. The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes running in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hurries down the aisle, keeping an eye on the securit camera. Making sure she stays on the far side, out of it's range. She stops in the middle of the aisle, starts to examine paint brushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing next to her, looking at a color chart, hidden from the security camera, as is she. He is pissed. He has the newspaper with Woogard's picture. He throws the paper in her face. Cat is taken aback by a display of anger she has never seen in this man before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you would stop the writing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he shoves an article cut from a paper in her face. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she starts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven people slaughtered in a Miami bar. I knew one of them. Years ago, in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it. This is getting too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tio. Could be anyone. You're seeing things that aren't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are so blinded by your need for revenge that you are not seeing things that are. The handwriting is on the wall Cara. Let me read it to you. This is over. I will no longer accept jobs. I will no longer solicit jobs. You are retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people did you kill in revenge for your boy's death? How many? And you're going to give me a lecture about revenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara. It's time to get a life, before you run out of time. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this will help you understand what I am telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio leaves first this time. Cat just stands there, her world rocked. She opens the envelope, takes out a photograph, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed for her first Communion. Everyone is smiling. She is holding a Cataleya orchid bouquet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes well up. She can't hold it anymore. She begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five six. Brown eyes, hazel really, dark hair, thick, shiny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is sitting with his friend RYAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great body, killer smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think about her all day long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you're in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. This comes from the heart. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl comes over, strips down, rocks your world, gets dressed, asks for nothing. Leaves. The only thing she doesn't do is bring the pizza and beer. You are living my dream. And you want to go and fuck it up with love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were the perfect guy to talk about this with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey come on. It's me. Since first grade. You and me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, I'm twenty eight. I met someone who I want to be with. All the time. I have nothing. A stuffed animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my phone. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny takes out his iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not even a whole picture. I took it while she was asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shows Ryan the picture he took of Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asleep in his bed, with the morning light on her face, half hidden by her position and her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...total babe-age! When do I meet the future Mrs. Delaney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you been listening to me? I don't even know how to get in touch with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. That is such a no brainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Danny stand beside SHARI, 26, who sits in front of her computer, attaching Danny's iPhone to a port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if you weren't my brother's best friend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing it for love Shari. Not for me. When they walk down the aisle, you can say you were the one made it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I shouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up to you Danny. I do it all the time. Photo goes in here. Bangs around the National Data base looking for a match. Bingo. Address, phone number, shoe size, dress size, rap sheet, anything you want to know. It's really no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just feel like, maybe, I'm invading her privacy or something. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys, I haven't got all day. (holds her hand on the send button on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny can't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the button. Cat's picture appears on the screen with the message: BEGIN DOWNLOAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's picture gets turned into millions of pixels, which start combining and recombining into faces that look like her, don't look like her, looking for a match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is staring at his Cataleya orchid, looking over his reports, frustrated, when his computer screen lights up the the following message: DATA MATCH 62%

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And alongside the half assed pictures of Cat from the security tapes in the police station, the picture from Danny's iPhone starts to form. Ross picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a trace put on an incoming transmission!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross continues watching his screen: DATA MATCH PROBABILIT 68%.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A map comes up on his screen immediately. A grid map of the city with a focus finder bringing the search area clo and closer. Until the area is identified: One Police Plaz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio, Mama and Pepe are sitting in a pew during Easter mass. Someone comes up from behind, sits down next to them. They turn to Cat. Who smiles, like a child. Emilio smiles back. Mama takes Cat's hand, kisses it. They all sit and listen to the Mass, like all the other families around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As everyone is exiting... 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara. You will come home for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Mama. One thing at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses them and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was such a nice surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it would happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone grows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's going to be OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As their car pulls into the driveway of the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From down the street. Watching Emilio, Mama, and Pepe enter the house. Marco. And three thugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a larger computer screen, the various pictures of Cat, none of them conclusive. As Ross and his team look on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a common base, so let's try size...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches his keyboard. The computer screen shuffles the pictures until they all match up, one on top of the other And on the screen: SIZE CONFIRMATION: MATCH 96%

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good...now let's see...hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He focuses in on the hands on the pictures from the secur tape and the ones from Danny's iPhone picture. The images start moving, matching. And when they are coordinated, on the screen: HAND CONFIRMATION: MATCH 95% 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking good. And now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He types in nose match. Again the pictures shuffle, line up. NOSE CONFIRMATION: MATCH 98%

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shower. The water pelting her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, outside the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, in a bra and panties, walks across to the kitchen, pours a drink. Downs half of it, then refills the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat sits by the living room window. Takes the last drop of the drink. As she looks out on the night sky, she ligh a cigarette. Feeling so alone. She takes one drag on the cigarette, stubs it out. She takes the picture of herself and her parents, looks at it, sighs deeply. A tear forms. Her loneliness, her sense of isolation grows. For the first time, she seems a bit lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sits by his window, also feeling a bit lost, and also, so lonely. He stares at the picture of Cat on his phone. When the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny's heart goes to his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! I can't believe it! Hello you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross's computer bings. Danny's name and number come up with the message: CALL ACTIVE. Ross looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I...no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just sitting here, looking out the window. And I thought...where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross and his team are listening to the call on an interco On the screen a tracer is looking for the location of the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my apartment. Looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're seeing the same sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS watches the search narrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm so happy to hear your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm happy to hear yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got her! I want SWAT there! All of them! Now! 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross and his team run out of their office. AND WE ARE BACK TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's so crazy. I was just sitting here, looking at your picture, thinking "I'd wish I could call her." And you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's antenna go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny gulps hard, realizing he has made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I know I shouldn't have. But I have nothing to remember you by, except this little stuffed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What picture Danny???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took a picture of you while you were sleeping. With my phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat leaps out of her chair, on full alert now. She opens her cabinet to the four screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen. I'm sorry. Really. I didn't mean to offend you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat attaches a device to her computer. Does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's just you looked so cute. I can erase it if you want. It's not even a good picture...Jen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is not listening, she is looking at a message flashin across the screen. THIRD PARTY ON LINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else saw the picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat flips the switch on her surveillance screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody. My friend Ryan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else? 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His sister. I didn't want to..it's just...I wanted to contact you. I wanted to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does the sister of Ryan have to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari, that's Ryan's sister...she works at Police headquarters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Cat knows everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On her surveillance screens, Cat sees FBI SWAT pulling up to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer. I know. Goodbye Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hangs up, rushes into the bathroom, turns the shower on full blast. Hurrying out, on her screens, she sees the SWAT swarming into the building. Cat opens a cabinet. On the back of the door are a dozen keys. She chooses one. She checks the screens one more time, sees the SWAT rushi the stairs, the elevators. She turns off her screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And runs out of the apartment in her t-shirt and panties. Barefoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT are running up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT led by Ross are watching the elevator numbers climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches the stairs just as the elevator is reaching her floor. She ducks down the stairs as the elevator door opens, and Ross and his team step out, guns raised, exercising extreme caution, keeping very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat takes the stairs two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT comes running up the stairs, two at a time. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swat 1 listens at Cat's door. Ross is at the end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers, on mic) Shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross signals for a scope. SWAT 2 takes a flex cam, and begins to slide it under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes to a door, uses her key to open it. She enters to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a guy eating his lunch in front of the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out to grab her. Cat grabs his hand and slams his face into his tray of food, knocking him cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross watches the screen as the flex cam shows the interio of Cat's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat pulls down a camouflaged hinged door in the ceiling. On it, is a harness, with several things attached, guns, charges, thick metal clips. She slips into the harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross's team goes from apartment to apartment. Knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the video cam, Ross is seeing nothing in Cat's apartme He points to one of the SWAT, signals for him to set char against the door. The man begins to do so. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is setting charges in a rectangular pattern on the rear bathtub wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents at an apartment door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ma'am everything is under control. We just need you to stay inside. May we have a look around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the FBI enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat has finished setting her charges. She looks up at the ceiling, listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross's man has finished setting the charges. He looks at Ross. The rest of the team fingers their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat waits, looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An FBI agent knocks on the door of the apartment she has just entered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross give the go ahead nod. The SWAT hits his detonator. At the same moment that his charges explode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hits hers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's door blows open, the SWAT flood in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect rectangle is blown in the wall, revealing utili pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross and his crew swarm all over the place. Find the shower, empty. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat has attached the hooks from the harness to the pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross barks into his walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here. Lock the building down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat lets go. And drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is looking at the bank of security monitors in Cat's cabinet, sees all his men, all over the place, inside the building, outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat lands on the floor, next to door. She unhooks herself from the pipes, and pushes out the door. Enters through to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks around, listens, and then begins to make her wa across the garage, using the parked cars as cover from th security cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross leads his men as they scour the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one in or out! Lock this place down! Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing here. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches an open space where cars just cannot shield her. There are two security cameras covering it. Cat draws one of her silencers and shoots the lens out of one camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An agent is standing next to the building security guard, when one camera goes out.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS V.O.
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...wait...one security camera down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat shoots the second camera. Heads across the open space quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second one is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie) All units! Converge on the garage. Cover every exit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat has reaches a vent, which she removes, having loosene the screws before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT and Ross's team flood the garage. Vehicles screeching in, men running in full body armor, guns ready

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is just climbing into the space behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO The SWAT ALL OVER THE PLACE 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look under every car. In every trunk!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hurries along a tunnel, comes to a utility door, and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat enters a room full of lockers. She starts opening them until she finds what she is looking for. A maintenan uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat walks along in coveralls, boots and a hard hat, passi several crews of workers welding, hammering, doing repair She disappears into the gloaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A normal day. Kids playing ball. Trashmen picking up trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat walks through the house like it could be a trap, a silencer in her hand. Her senses are keening, she is that alert. And then she finds the first body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama. Dead. A bullet in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat has all she can do to keep it together. Then she find Pepe, a bullet in his head. It is almost too much for her to bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she finds Emilio, tied to a chair, tortured. To death. This IS too much for her to bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat cuts Emilio's beaten and bloodied body loose, and gen takes HIM in her arms. And begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...I'm sorry...I'm sorry 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An operator answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation. How may I direct your call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is on a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to speak to the agent in charge of the TAG killings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is pinning up the pictures of Cat on his board. His phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Ross. Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is emptying out. In the lobby, Ross passes a floor cleaner and a lone security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross picks up a prepackaged meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross enters his building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross enters, turns on the lights, revealing an apartment as austere as Cat's. Heads for the small kitchen, where he is about to put his precooked meal in the microwave. When he feels a gun in the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This won't take long. Hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross raises his hands. Cat reaches around, removes his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross faces her. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions him into the chair behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, all this? Being so smart? Covering all your bases? It's not going to matter. It's already over. The whole place is wired with web cams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His moment of triumph is short lived. Cat reaches on the side of the counter. Holds up six web cams, wires ripped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tosses the ripped out cams onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking about covering all your bases. Your chair is pressure wired. You move your ass one inch you don't have one anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross looks under the chair. Sure enough, there are severa wires leading out of the bottom of the chair. He looks further to the where the wires attach to a small charge. She puts her gun down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking. Maybe yes a bluff, maybe no. But you have to figure yes, given what you know about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross does not move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't what I had in mind for myself when I was a kid. I wanted to be on the other side of things. Like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out an old picture of Don Luis, lifted from the internet. She takes out the picture of her parents and her as an eight year old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last time I was happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next day they were dead. He killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all this? All these clues...they weren't for us. They were for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know how else to find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you figured sooner or later we would make this public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took you a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else do I have to be? I have no one. I did. Until this morning. I had them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out pictures of dead Mama, dead Emilio, dead Pepe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sent him a message. He sent you one back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I want to finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can. He's protected by your government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By a part of the government I have no way of reaching. It's CIA. I don't know why. But there's no getting through it, under it, around it, believe me, I've tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to try harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a photo album out, opens it. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this on your table inside. Your family, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begins to flip pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brothers, sisters, nieces, nephews. Mother, father. Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross knows what is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this sounds harsh. But until I get what I want, you'll go to a funeral a week. And you will begin to feel what I have felt all these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She places the photo album in his lap. Puts his food in the microwave, starts it. Goes to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When your dinner's ready, the timer on it will have expired. Then you can get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she is gone. Ross watches the timer on the microwave. When it beeps, he sits a moment longer. Hesitates to get up. Little by little, he moves himself off the chair, tentative. Afraid that any moment, BOOM! Until he makes the final move, stands just enough to clear the seat, waiting for the worst to happen. And when it doesn't, he breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A non descript building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing a large picture window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand, I only agreed to this meeting out of professional courtesy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President wanting us to reach out to you folks on the domestic side, and all that pie in the sky crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, I really can't help you at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't or won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, let's put all our cards on the table here. I've met this woman. The killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apartment. She trapped me. She told me if I did not get her this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts Luis's picture on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will kill a member of my family every day until I have none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard pauses. Then he begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like I could make something like that up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? What should I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go to the police. Now if you'll excuse me, I have a meeting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to rise, when Ross's phone rings. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says you either give her what she wants or she is going to redecorate your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross points to Richard's chest where a red laser beam hol on his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she think this is? Amateur hour? Tell her that glass is tempered to resist a direct hit by a fifty seven millimeter ordinance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the sudden, a bullet shatters the window; destroyi a picture of Richard standing with the President hanging on the wall just behind his head. The red dot is back on Richard in a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says she's using seven point six two steel jacketed armor piercing shells. And you have ten seconds to give her the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard starts to come unglued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I be sure once she has the address she won't kill me anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't. But I can assure you that if you don't give her the address you will be number twenty four on her hit parade. Trust me on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After an interminable moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight seven six Magnolia Terrace... New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause on the other end of the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asked you to keep this conversation strictly confidential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With pleasure. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, the red dot disappears from Richard's che Richard breathes out. Ross reaches out, shakes richard's limp hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Because honestly I didn't know how I was going to explain you splattered all over your walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross exits. Richard looks at the shattered picture. The President's head is intact. The bullet has ripped Richard face clean off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A BIG STEEL DOOR OPENING REVEALING An ARMORY OF WEAPONS FROM PISTOLS TO RPG's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat loads weapons and ammo into Pepe's big red truck. The last thing she takes: a LAWS rocket launcher. The dogs sit there, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys ever been to New Orleans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the dog's puzzled faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red truck smashes through the doors of Pepe's warehou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck heads off down the road, disappearing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat drives through the night, just watching the road. The dogs sit behind her, also watching the road. She passes a sign: NEW ORLEANS 500 MILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMITH, a courtly old architect, opens his door and enters his building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith enters to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting, with two cups of coffee, and pastries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know if you took sugar and cream, so I got one of each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You designed the house at eight seven six Magnolia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You either leave immediately young lady or I am going to call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat pulls a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would love to see the plans of this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will take up positions here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Don Luis sips a cognac, staring out the big bay window onto the wide street beyond the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house sits prominent in the middle of a quiet neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco points to the floor plan, explaining to the dozen thugs gathered with their weapons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here. And here. You must expect the unexpected. She is like mist under a door, like a mouse in the wall. She will never attack straight on. You will not see her, until it is too late. She is that invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON DON LUIS as he sips his cognac. He sees a big red truc approaching in the distance up the road. As he watches, squinting, curious, the truck does an abrupt U turn. Marc drones on in the background... 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would prefer she be taken alive. But with a bitch like this, if you get a kill shot you take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Don Luis watches, as a woman gets out of the truck. He cannot make out who it is, what with the fog and his vision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the woman open the rear door of the truck, and pull something out. He takes his glasses out of his pocke puts them on. Just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing the rocket heading right for the salon. They all leap out of the way, just as the rocket comes crashing through the bay window. And blows the salon to smithereen Cat reenters the truck, drives off fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the debris falls, and the dust and smoke rises, Marco helps Don Luis up. He is a little stunned. Through the gaping hole where the bay window was, they see the red truck driving off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You four! Get the armored Mercedes! We have to get Don Luis out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis! This way! Everyone to their positions!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they all run out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four thugs run into the garage, where there are sever cars. And a big armored van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK! Everyone in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But just as they open the doors to the big Mercedes... 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat leaps out of the truck, and before the four startled thugs know what has hit them, she puts three of them down with shots to the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fourth runs out the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fourth thug runs for all he is worth, bleeding from his forehead, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calmly exiting the garage, she removes a set of throwing knives from a belt around her waist, taking a long minute to gauge the distance. When he has almost reached the safety of the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops like dead lead, the two knives embedded in his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the house, seeing Cat through a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking back at him. Pointing a finger at him. Before she disappears in to the drifting mists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis! You hide here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens a secret door in the wall, revealing a small spa Barely big enough for a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for my call. Either she is dead, or we have her far enough away so you can make it to the garage. Take the van. The armor is so thick nothing short of an atomic bomb can penetrate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco. Thank you. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the first time you ever said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis shuts the door. Off the door slamming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another door opens, but this one is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the side of the mansion, and leads into the foundation Cat crawls in and pulls the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco and the men are walking through the mansion, guns a the ready, when they come to a long stretch of hallway. Marco signals them to stop. He listens carefully. Signals for one of the men to move down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marco and the other men wait, the first thug makes his way down the hall, looking left and right, opening doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the man walks along above, the floor creaks, dust drop down in a fine cloud. As the man progresses, and the dust gets closer and closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns to Marco to signal everything is OK. Just as he signals he is riddled from below with dozens of bullets. The man dances like a puppet on a string, before falling to the floor, dead. Marco takes a grenade out, flings it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco and the thugs dive for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grenade blows a big hole in the floor. As soon as the smoke and the debris stop falling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs hesitate. Marco points his gun at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesitant, the thugs approach the hole. Pointing their weapons, they unload a barrage of bullets. Then stop. Nothing moves. One of them peers over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single shot pieces his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs and Marco run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs set up two big ass 50 caliber machine guns at the two openings in the foundation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs manning the guns let loose, blasting away. Smok and flashes from the muzzles mingle with the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis hears the firing, which thunders through his closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs fire until their ammo is spent. As the sound dies away, silence reigns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis hears the silence. He speed dials on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions for one of his men to look into the dark hope. Hesitant the man peeks around the side. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we got her. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis lets out a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco urges his man to look deeper, expose himself more, to look in the hole. Marco watches as the man does so, very cautiously. Still no movement. He moves full body into the opening to peer in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is blown back by three fast shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he starts screaming into the hole, careful to stand just off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what bitch? I loved killing your father. He was a coward! And you know what else? I screwed your mother behind your father's back! We all did! She couldn't get enough of it! The whore! I killed her! I killed him! You want to avenge them? The whore and the coward? That's what you come from! Come out! I'm here! Come get the bullet with your name on it, Bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. And then, a whistle from above. Marco looks up to see Cat, standing on a second floor balcony with two pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco starts to fire, his men raise their guns. Too late. In the blink of an eye, with bullets flying wildly all around her, Cat blows five of the seven thugs surrounding Marco away. Marco and the remaining two thugs run toward the guest house. Out of the range of her guns. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis is panicking. Yelling into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco! Marco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco and the two thugs run into the small house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two here! That door opens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the door they just came through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...kill anything that comes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco runs into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco runs to the curtained windows, rips the curtains back, hoping to escape. And finds that the windows have metal hurricane shutters on them. With locks. Marco pulls out a set of keys, frantically tries fitting the keys to the locks. None of them work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs for the door again. Just as he has his hand on the knob, two shots ring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giorgio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. He checks his gun, realizes he is out of ammo. He knows his time has come. He drops is gun, backs away from the door. Backs right up to the bed, and sits down. His phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco! What the hell's going on???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco just stares at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a small sound outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will hold here! Run! Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shatters as Cat kicks her way in. Marco pulls his trigger. Click! Click! Click! Marco is frozen. Just stares at Cat. Waiting for what is going to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it! Do it you bitch! Isn't this the moment you've been waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She empties her gun into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gripped by fear, Don Luis runs for all he is worth across the fog shrouded garden until he reaches the garage. He yanks open the door, runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis runs around Pepe's red truck and the crumbled Mercedes, jumps in the armored van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis fumbles with the keys, grinds the ignition in hi desperation. The engine turns over. Don Luis slams the transmission into gear, but bangs into the crumbled Merce blocking his way. He slams the gearshift into reverse, bashes into the wall behind him, and then jerks the gear shift into drive, ramming the Mercedes with a little more room. Back and forth back and forth, Don Luis rams at the Mercedes until he has made enough room to turn the van, bang past the Mercedes, and smash his way out of the gara

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van comes roaring out of the garage, tearing up the gardens, jumping on the driveway and speeding off to the main road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes running from the opposite direction, two guns blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As bullets ping off the van, Don Luis regains some of his confidence. A small smile breaks across his face as he looks in his rear view mirror and sees Cat running and firing, losing ground. 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches the end of the driveway, fires her last shots runs out of bullets. Stands watching the van head off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis watches her run out of ammo, standing in the roa receding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beat you bitch! You can't kill me! I am unkillable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat stands in the road, watching the van. She takes out Marco's cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat scrolls the phone book. She highlights VAN. Presses SEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis is at a red light, so pleased with himself. Humming a tune. When the van phone rings. Surprised, he looks at the call coming in. MARCO. He presses the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Cataleya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand you. You should have been dead a long time ago. You got lucky. You escaped. You were given a second chance at a life. Why did you not take it? Why did you involve yourself with this insanity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For something you can never understand. The love I had for my parents. And you killed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because of that, you have ruined your whole life to try to kill me? You stupid bitch. Don't you get it? Someone like me?

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I cannot be killed. I do the killing. Not the other way around. And now it is your turn to be hunted. You will never find me. But as day follows night, believe me, I will find you. And I will kill you. And you know why? Because I will never be where you can kill me. I will never be where you want me to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually Don Luis...you are exactly where I want you to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis doesn't get it. And then he hears a low growling behind him. He turns a little, sees sitting there in the dark recesses of the van, two enormous dogs. Pepe's dogs. His eyes register confusion, then apprehension...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hears the growl over the phone. A small smile breaks across her face. And then se speaks into the phone one last time. One word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the sounds of the dogs tearing Don Luis to pieces an his horrible screams, the van shakes as if it were caught in an earthquake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's shoulders sag, relax. Her face is peaceful as it has never been before. She looks at Marco's phone. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS V.O.
dialogues.text: I want you to think hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sits opposite Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you everything. She would come over, we'd have amazing sex, and she would leave. It's really late, and I'm really tired, if you're not going to arrest me... 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't really have anything to charge you with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then can I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross gets up and leaves the room. Danny is feeling really shitty. He takes his phone out of his pocket, looks at Cat's picture. And then it rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CAT V.O.
dialogues.text: Hello Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen...I...uh...I'm so sorry. I didn't mean...are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: CAT V.O.
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says it without the slightest bit of sarcasm.

dialogues.speaker: CAT V.O.
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI headquarters. I didn't tell them anything...besides...

dialogues.speaker: CAT V.O.
dialogues.text: That I would come over and we would have amazing sex. Your phone is tapped, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: CAT V.O.
dialogues.text: You have forty seconds before they pick up on this. Gives you the time for three questions. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK...What's your real name?

dialogues.speaker: CAT V.O.
dialogues.text: ...Cataleya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks at the orchid on Ross's desk. Sees the name tag. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the flower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Cat smiles. How did he know that?

dialogues.speaker: CAT V.O.
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I ever see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is drawing coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross. We're picking something up off that kid's phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross drops the coffee, hurries back to the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is ever a chance. I want you to know...I could love you. If you let me.

dialogues.speaker: CAT V.O.
dialogues.text: Last question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat holds on that one for a moment...then the beeping of phone connection cut...Danny closes his eyes. Ross bursts into the office. Grabs the phone from his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cataleya? Cataleya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, in jeans, t-shirt, a baseball cap with her pony tail sticking out the back, exits a phone booth, She boards a waiting bus. The doors close. The bus drives off down an endless road. 117.
